species.name: Human
species.description: Versatile and adaptable, excelling in a variety of roles, with balanced abilities across the board.

species.name: Elf
species.description: Elegant and long-lived, closed attuned to nature and magic, with heightened dexterity and intellect.

species.name: Dwarven
species.description: Tough and resilient, known for their strength, endurance, and mastery of metalworks and stonecraft.

species.name: Orc
species.description: Strong and fierce warriors, driven by their tribal culture and natural combat prowess.

species.name: Goblin
species.description: Small, quick, and clever, often relying on stealth, traps, and trickery to outwit their enemies.

species.name: Lizardfolk
species.description: Reptilian humanoids with natural armor and an affinity for water, known for their survial instincts.

species.name: Kobold
species.description: Small, dragon-like creatures that are cowardly but skilled in creating complex traps and tunnels.

species.name: Gnome
species.description: Inventive and curious, adept at both magic and machinery, with a knck for tinkering and experimentation.

species.name: Troll
species.description: Large and regenerative, trolls are slow but incredibly strong, able to heal wounds quickly.

species.name: Centaur
species.description: Half-human, half-horse being, known for their speed and archery skills, as well as their nomadic lifestyle.

species.name: Felinid
species.description: Agile and cat-like, with enhanced reflexes and senses, making them excellent hunters and scouts.

species.name: Draconid
species.description: Dragon-blooded humanoids with the ability to harness elemental magic effectively, often feared and respected.

species.name: Triton
species.description: Ocean-dwelling warriors with mastery over water, able to communicate with sea creatures and control tides.
